framework.engine

Class DisplayableObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • framework.engine.DisplayableObject
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Triangle

    public abstract class DisplayableObject
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstract class to be inherited by all objects to be displayed in Scene

    Contains abstract display() method that must be overloaded. display() is called from a parent Scene.

    Version:
    1.0.0
    11 Sep 2015
    Author:
    wil

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected Scene parent
      Rendering window to display this DisplayableObject in.
      protected processing.core.PVector pos
      PVector containing World Space position coordinates
      protected processing.core.PVector rotation
      PVector containing angles of orientation in World Space for x, y, and z axes
      protected processing.core.PVector scale
      PVector containing relative World Space scaling values for x,y,z.

    • Constructor Summary

    • Field Detail

      • parent

        protected Scene parent
        Rendering window to display this DisplayableObject in.

        Contains Processing links with OpenGL. All calls to the renderer must be made directly through parent.

      • pos

        protected processing.core.PVector pos
        PVector containing World Space position coordinates

      • rotation

        protected processing.core.PVector rotation
        PVector containing angles of orientation in World Space for x, y, and z axes

      • scale

        protected processing.core.PVector scale
        PVector containing relative World Space scaling values for x,y,z.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DisplayableObject

        public DisplayableObject(Scene parent)
        Constructor for DisplayableObject that sets up link to rendering window commands.

        Abstract class so constructor should only be called by sub-class via super(parent)

        Parameters:
        parent - Your Scene.
        See Also:
        DisplayableObject

    • Method Detail

      • display

        public abstract void display()
        Abstract class. Called from Scene parent

      • orientation

        Get orientation in World Space
        Returns:
        PVector containing angles of rotation around each axis
        See Also:

      • orientation

        public void orientation(float rx,
                        float ry,
                        float rz)
        Set orientation in World Space

        Specify angles for x, y and z axial rotations

        Parameters:
        rx - Angle of rotation around x-axis
        ry - Angle of rotation around y-axis
        rz - Angle of rotation around z-axis
        See Also:
        orientation()

      • size

        public void size(float s)
        Set size in World Space

        Equally scaled in all axes

        Parameters:
        s - Scale in x,y,z axes
        See Also:
        size(float sx, float sy, float sz), size()

      • size

        public void size(float sx,
                 float sy,
                 float sz)
        Set size in World Space

        Specify separate scales for each axis

        Parameters:
        sx - Scale in x axis
        sy - Scale in y axis
        sz - Scale in z axis
        See Also:
        size(float s), size()

      • transform

        public void transform()
        Transform object to its relative position and orientation.

        Call this function at the beginning of display.
